@javascript

Feature: Admin adds menu link

Background

  1. Given "kassi_testperson1" has admin rights in community "test"
    features/step_definitions/user_steps.rb:199
  2. And I am logged in as "kassi_testperson1"
    features/step_definitions/user_steps.rb:33
  3. And I am on the menu links admin page
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:55
features/admin/admin_adds_menu_link.feature:9

Scenario: Admin adds menu link

  1. When I follow "Add a new link to menu"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:75
  2. And I fill in "menu_links[menu_link_attributes][jsnew-1][translation_attributes][en][title]" with "Sharetribe Blog"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:101
  3. And I fill in "menu_links[menu_link_attributes][jsnew-1][translation_attributes][en][url]" with "http://blog.sharetribe.com"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:101
  4. And I fill in "menu_links[menu_link_attributes][jsnew-1][translation_attributes][fi][title]" with "Sharetribe Blogi"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:101
  5. And I fill in "menu_links[menu_link_attributes][jsnew-1][translation_attributes][fi][url]" with "http://blog.sharetribe.com"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:101
  6. And I press submit
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:69
  7. Then I should see "Details updated"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:186
  8. When I open the menu
    features/step_definitions/header_steps.rb:55
  9. Then I should see "Sharetribe Blog" on the menu
    features/step_definitions/header_steps.rb:37

Feature: Admin edits info pages

In order to have custom detail texts tailored specifically for my community
As an admin
I want to be able to edit the community details

Background

  1. Given "kassi_testperson1" has admin rights in community "test"
    features/step_definitions/user_steps.rb:199
  2. And I am logged in as "kassi_testperson1"
    features/step_definitions/user_steps.rb:33
features/admin/admin_edits_community_details.feature:11

Scenario: Admin user can edit community details

  1. When I go to the admin view of community "test"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:59
  2. And I fill in "community_customizations[en][name]" with "Custom name"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:101
  3. And I fill in "community_customizations[en][slogan]" with "Custom slogan"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:101
  4. And I fill in "community_customizations[en][description]" with "This is a custom description"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:101
  5. And I press submit
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:69
  6. When I follow "view_slogan_link"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:75
  7. Then I should see "Custom slogan"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:186
  8. And I should see "This is a custom description"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:186

The Sharetribe-service may only be used in accordance with these terms of use. The service provider reserves the right to change these terms of use if required. Valid terms of use can be found from Sharetribe’s website. Rights of Content The users themselves retain the right to all text, pictures and other content that they create in the service. The users allow others to utilize the content in accordance with the nature of the service and furthermore allow the service provider to file information and data and make changes that are necessary for the service or the study, however other rights are not transferred from the users, unless specifically otherwise agreed. The responsibility of the content lies with the user, who has produced it to the service. The service provider has the right to remove any material when it deems it necessary. Disclaimer No guarantees of the functioning of the Sharetribe service are given. The users are themselves responsible for their actions in the service and they should estimate the reliability of other users before dealing with them. The service provider can under no circumstances be liable for damage that is caused to the user. The user may not store any information or data in the service, and expect it to remain there. The Removal of a User The service provider has the right to remove any users from Sharetribe and terminate their right of use of the service without any specific reason and without being liable for compensation. Applicable Jurisdiction The jurisdiction that is applicable in this service and these terms of use is that of Finland, unless something else is required by binding law." Details can be used for communication between service providers and users and also for direct communication between users. Some personal details are visible on the profile page of the user, but those details are voluntary (except name). The handling of personal details is not outsourced, but the register data is stored on a server that is rented from a third party company. Information content of the register The following information may be stored in the register: Personal details: Name, email address, phone number, street address Account details: username, password (stored in encrypted format) The description text that the user may write about him/herself The offers and requests the user has posted to the service The given and received feedback and badges Statistical data about service usage, e.g. number times the user has logged in Regular sources of information Personal details are given by the user on registration to the service or when using it later. Regular handovers of the information The information may be handed over for research purposes as described in the Terms of use that the user accepts before starting to use the service. The researchers may not publish any research results so that identifying information would be revealed or that any specific user could be detected. Information considering users of a single Sharetribe community may be handed over to the client who has founded that community or to the community administrators appointed by that client. Transfers of the information outside the EU and the European Economic Area Information may be stored to a server that may be located inside or outside of the EU and the European Economic Area Register protection principles The information is stored on computers. The access to the information is restricted with passwords and physical access to the computers is restricted by the server hosting company." (RSpec::Expectations::ExpectationNotMetError)

Feature: Admin edits menu link

Background

  1. Given "kassi_testperson1" has admin rights in community "test"
    features/step_definitions/user_steps.rb:199
  2. And there is a menu link
    features/step_definitions/header_steps.rb:20
  3. And the title is "Blog link" and the URL is "http://blog.sharetribe.com/" with locale "en" for that menu link
    features/step_definitions/header_steps.rb:25
  4. And the title is "Verkkopäiväkirja" and the URL is "http://blog.sharetribe.com/" with locale "fi" for that menu link
    features/step_definitions/header_steps.rb:25
  5. And there is a menu link
    features/step_definitions/header_steps.rb:20
  6. And the title is "Homepage link" and the URL is "http://sharetribe.com/" with locale "en" for that menu link
    features/step_definitions/header_steps.rb:25
  7. And the title is "Kotisivu" and the URL is "http://sharetribe.com/" with locale "fi" for that menu link
    features/step_definitions/header_steps.rb:25
  8. And I am logged in as "kassi_testperson1"
    features/step_definitions/user_steps.rb:33
  9. And I am on the menu links admin page
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:55
features/admin/admin_edits_menu_link.feature:18

Feature: Admin edits welcome

In order to have custom welcome email content tailored specifically for my community
As an admin
I want to be able to edit the welcome email content

    features/step_definitions/admin_custom_field_steps.rb:51

    features/step_definitions/admin_custom_field_steps.rb:47

    features/step_definitions/conversation_steps.rb:261
  28. Then I should see that the request was confirmed
    features/step_definitions/conversation_steps.rb:268

@javascript

Feature: User confirms a transaction

In order to be able to give feedback to the other party
As a user
I want to be able to confirm a transaction as happened

Background

  1. Given there are following users:
    features/step_definitions/user_steps.rb:98
    person
    kassi_testperson1
    kassi_testperson2
  2. And the community has payments in use via BraintreePaymentGateway
    features/step_definitions/community_steps.rb:100
  3. And Braintree escrow release is mocked
    features/step_definitions/payment_steps.rb:95
  4. And "kassi_testperson2" has an active Braintree account
    features/step_definitions/payment_steps.rb:29
  5. And there is a listing with title "Skateboard" from "kassi_testperson2" with category "Items" and with listing shape "Selling"
    features/step_definitions/listing_steps.rb:1
  6. And the price of that listing is 20.00 USD
    features/step_definitions/listing_steps.rb:17
  7. And there is a pending request "I'd like to buy a skate" from "kassi_testperson1" about that listing
    features/step_definitions/conversation_steps.rb:45
  8. And there is a payment for that request from "kassi_testperson1" with price "20"
    features/step_definitions/payment_steps.rb:34
  9. And the request is paid
    features/step_definitions/conversation_steps.rb:67
  10. And I am logged in as "kassi_testperson1"
    features/step_definitions/user_steps.rb:33
  11. When I follow inbox link
    features/step_definitions/header_steps.rb:69
  12. Then I should see "Waiting for you to mark the request completed"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:186
  13. When I follow "paid $20"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:75
  14. And I follow "Mark completed"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:75

Feature: User browses listings

In order to find out what kind of offers and requests there are available in Sharetribe
As a person who needs something or has something
I want to be able to browse offers and requests

  1. Given there are following users:

    person
    kassi_testperson1
    kassi_testperson2
  2. And there is a listing with title "car spare parts" from "kassi_testperson2" with category "Items" and with listing shape "Selling"
    features/step_definitions/listing_steps.rb:1
  3. And there is a listing with title "massage" from "kassi_testperson1" with category "Services" and with listing shape "Selling services"
    features/step_definitions/listing_steps.rb:1

    features/step_definitions/listing_steps.rb:1
  7. And there is a listing with title "axe" from "kassi_testperson2" with category "Items" and with listing shape "Lending"
    features/step_definitions/listing_steps.rb:1
  8. And that listing is closed
    features/step_definitions/listing_steps.rb:28
  9. And there is a listing with title "toolbox" from "kassi_testperson2" with category "Items" and with listing shape "Requesting"

    features/step_definitions/listing_steps.rb:64

    features/step_definitions/listing_steps.rb:1

    features/step_definitions/listing_steps.rb:1

    features/step_definitions/listing_steps.rb:60
  7. And privacy of that listing is "private"
    features/step_definitions/listing_steps.rb:64

    features/step_definitions/listing_steps.rb:28

    features/step_definitions/search_steps.rb:1

In order to announce that a listing is now longer valid and cannot be replied
As the author of the listing
I want to be able to close the listing

Scenario: User closes and opens listing successfully and select a new subcategory

  1. Given there are following users:
    features/step_definitions/user_steps.rb:98
    person
    kassi_testperson1
  2. And there is a listing with title "Hammer" from "kassi_testperson1" with category "Items" and with listing shape "Requesting"
    features/step_definitions/listing_steps.rb:1
  3. And I am logged in as "kassi_testperson1"
    features/step_definitions/user_steps.rb:33
  4. When I follow "Hammer"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:75
  5. And I follow "Close listing"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:75
  6. And I should see "Listing is closed" within "#listing-message-links"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:186

    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:186
  8. And I should not see "Edit listing" within "#listing-message-links"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:211

    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:211

    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:75

    features/step_definitions/listing_steps.rb:275

    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:63

    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:186

@javascriptfeatures/listings/user_comments_a_listing.feature:7

Scenario: Adding a new comment successfully

  1. Given there are following users:
    features/step_definitions/user_steps.rb:98
    person
    kassi_testperson1
    kassi_testperson2
  2. And there is a listing with title "Massage" from "kassi_testperson1" with category "Services" and with listing shape "Requesting"
    features/step_definitions/listing_steps.rb:1
  3. And listing comments are in use in community "test"
    features/step_definitions/listing_steps.rb:193
  4. And I am logged in as "kassi_testperson2"
    features/step_definitions/user_steps.rb:33
  5. When I follow "Massage"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:75
  6. And I should see "Get emails about new comments"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:186
  7. And I should not see "Don't get emails about new comments"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:211

  16. And I follow "Massage"

  17. And I press "Send comment"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:63

    features/step_definitions/general_steps.rb:7

    features/step_definitions/general_steps.rb:7

    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:59

    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:75

    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:101

@javascriptfeatures/listings/user_comments_a_listing.feature:70

Scenario: Users get email from followed listing

  1. Given there are following users:
    features/step_definitions/user_steps.rb:98
    person
    email
    given_name
    family_name
    kassi_testperson1
    t1@example.com
    John
    MacTest
    kassi_testperson2
    t2@example.com
    Anthony
    Debugger
  2. And there is a listing with title "Walking dogs" from "kassi_testperson1" with category "Services" and with listing shape "Requesting"
    features/step_definitions/listing_steps.rb:1
  3. And listing comments are in use in community "test"
    features/step_definitions/listing_steps.rb:193
  4. And I am logged in as "kassi_testperson2"
    features/step_definitions/user_steps.rb:33
  5. When I follow "Walking dogs"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:75
  6. Then I should see "Notify me of new comments and updates"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:186
  7. When I fill in "comment_content" with "Test comment 1"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:101
  8. And I press "Send comment"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:63
  9. Then I should see "Test comment 1" within "#comments"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:186
    10. [Worker(host:osboxes pid:58169)] CommentCreatedJob completed after 0.0876
  10. And "t1@example.com" should receive an email with subject "Anthony D has commented on your listing in Sharetribe"
    features/step_definitions/email_steps.rb:113
  11. And "t2@example.com" should have no emails
    features/step_definitions/email_steps.rb:106
  12. When I log out

# And I should not see "sewing"

    features/step_definitions/user_steps.rb:98

    features/step_definitions/listing_steps.rb:1
  3. And there is a listing with title "massage" from "kassi_testperson1" with category "Services" and with listing shape "Requesting"
    features/step_definitions/listing_steps.rb:1
  4. And there is a listing with title "Helsinki - Turku" from "kassi_testperson1" with category "Services" and with listing shape "Selling services"
    features/step_definitions/listing_steps.rb:1
  5. And there is a listing with title "Housing" from "kassi_testperson2" with category "Spaces" and with listing shape "Selling"
    features/step_definitions/listing_steps.rb:1
  6. And there is a listing with title "apartment" from "kassi_testperson1" with category "Spaces" and with listing shape "Requesting"
    features/step_definitions/listing_steps.rb:1
  7. And that listing is closed
    features/step_definitions/listing_steps.rb:28
  8. And I am not logged in
    features/step_definitions/user_steps.rb:58
  9. And I am on the home page
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:55
  10. When I follow "car spare parts"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:75

    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:75
  12. Then I should see "car spare parts"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:186

    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:186
  14. And I should not see "Housing"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:211
  15. And I should not see "apartment"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:211
  16. And I should see "massage"

    features/step_definitions/listing_steps.rb:28

    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:75

    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:75
  15. Then I should see "car spare parts"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:186

    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:186
  17. And I should not see "apartment"

    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:75
  19. Then I should see "apartment"

Feature: User logging in and out

In order to log in and out of Sharetribe
As a user
I want to be able to enter username and password and log in to Sharetribe and also log out

Scenario: logging in successfully

  1. Given I am not logged in
    features/step_definitions/user_steps.rb:58
  2. And I am on the login page
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:55
  3. When I fill in "main_person_login" with "kassi_testperson1"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:101
  4. And I fill in "main_person_password" with "testi"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:101
  5. And I click "#main_log_in_button"
    features/step_definitions/general_steps.rb:19
  6. Then I should see "Welcome, Kassi!"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:186
  7. Then I should be logged in
    features/step_definitions/header_steps.rb:113
features/sessions/user_logging_in_and_out.feature:15

  1. Given I am not logged in
    features/step_definitions/user_steps.rb:58
  2. And I am on the login page
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:55
  3. When I fill in "main_person_login" with "whatever"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:101
  4. And I fill in "main_person_password" with "certainly_not_the_correct_password"
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:101
  5. And I click "#main_log_in_button"
    features/step_definitions/general_steps.rb:19
  6. Then I should see "Sign in failed."
    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:186
  7. Then I should not be logged in
    features/step_definitions/header_steps.rb:121

  3. And I am not logged in
    features/step_definitions/user_steps.rb:58

    features/step_definitions/web_steps.rb:55
  5. When I fill in "main_person_login" with "kassi_testperson1"
